page.title: 11Local history-The Towers.
page.content: Reculver Towers is a famous local landmark as well as a historical site.The site was first used by the Romans as a fort.It was first built about 210 A.D.as one of the forts of The Saxon Shore,when the Romans were trying to keep out the invading Saxons.When the Romans left the area the fort fell into a ruin.In 669 King Egbert of Kent gave the land to a group of monks to build a monastry and church.Local people used the church.A legend says that the two towers of the church (most of which remains today) were built in memory of Isabella de St Claire who drowned nearby.Her twin sister is said to be buried with her and the towers became known as the sisters in memory of the twins.The church was however left to fall into a bd state because the area was fairly poor and there was always a shortage of
